Articles.Content:
I'd like to be able to have animated textures on a mu file that move depending on the throttle. I've seen parts here where the textures kinda "scroll" along the mesh, so:

1. Can I animate textures like that?

2. Can I change the speed of the animation with the throttle?

Without a plugin, or at least with available plugins.

I think the anim you want may need use of FXModuleAnimateThrottle (see stock Ion engine, in 0.23, dunno if it has changed in 0.23.5), but as emissive anim, I'm pretty sure unity 4.2.2 will be needed to do the job.

And

is an unity tutorial about animated texture which may help you.

I thought of something similar myself a while ago, for kind of monitor display with some data displayed in a loop, but I haven't dig into this matter yet.

Actually I think I made a mistake. This question is really for the red bussard collector animation. I thought that that red tip was something else, and I thought it's somehow tied to warp speed. That tutorial doesn't really help me unless someone wants to create a plugin for animating sprite sheets
